DataElement.preferredName: Disease or Disorder Best Outcome of Therapy Amyloidosis Other Organ System Status Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A description of the best other organ system response to therapy for amyloidosis.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Disease or Disorder Best Outcome of Therapy
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function._Having the most positive qualities._The result of therapy for a given disease or condition in a patient or group of patients.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A definite pathologic process with a characteristic set of signs and symptoms. It may affect the whole body or any of its parts, and its etiology, pathology, and prognosis may be known or unknown.

Concepts.definition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Property.preferredDefinition: Having the most positive qualities.:The result of therapy for a given disease or condition in a patient or group of patients.

Concepts.definition: The result of therapy for a given disease or condition in a patient or group of patients.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the response criteria (includes RECIST and others) and associated documentation of disease.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Amyloidosis Other Organ System Status Type
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A disorder characterized by the localized or diffuse accumulation of amyloid protein in various anatomic sites. It may be primary, due to clonal plasma cell proliferations; secondary, due to long standing infections, chronic inflammatory disorders, or malignancies; or familial. It may affect the nerves, skin, tongue, joints, heart, liver, spleen, kidneys and adrenal glands._Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned._An anatomical structure that consists of organs and organ subclasses responsible for certain body functions.  Representative examples are the gastrointestinal system, urinary system, and hematopoietic system._A condition or state at a particular time._Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The pathologic and/or clinical changes that result from treatment. The changes may refer to eradication of detectable disease, stabilization of disease, or disease progression.

Concepts.definition: The pathologic and/or clinical changes that result from treatment. The changes may include eradication of detectable disease, stabilization of disease, or disease progression.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The worsening of a disease over time

Concepts.definition: A process that manifests as the worsening of a disease over time.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Updated VM definitions to reflect change in NCIt concept definition. mc 10/31/13

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Amyloidosis Other Organ System Status Type
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A disorder characterized by the localized or diffuse accumulation of amyloid protein in various anatomic sites. It may be primary, due to clonal plasma cell proliferations; secondary, due to long standing infections, chronic inflammatory disorders, or malignancies; or familial. It may affect the nerves, skin, tongue, joints, heart, liver, spleen, kidneys and adrenal glands.:Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.:An anatomical structure that consists of organs and organ subclasses responsible for certain body functions.  Representative examples are the gastrointestinal system, urinary system, and hematopoietic system.:A condition or state at a particular time.:Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

Concepts.definition: A disorder characterized by the localized or diffuse accumulation of amyloid protein in various anatomic sites. It may be primary, due to clonal plasma cell proliferations; secondary, due to long standing infections, chronic inflammatory disorders, or malignancies; or familial. It may affect the nerves, skin, tongue, joints, heart, liver, spleen, kidneys and adrenal glands.
Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

An anatomical structure that consists of organs and organ subclasses responsible for certain body functions.  Representative examples are the gastrointestinal system, urinary system, and hematopoietic system.
A condition or state at a particular time.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
